course.subject: MECH
course.name: Thermodynamics
course.description: Fundamental concepts; pure substance; work and heat; control volume; Ideal and real gases. First and second laws of thermodynamics. Entropy. Elementary power and refrigeration cycles.
course.prerequisites: MATH 1012 OR MATH 1013 OR MATH 1020 OR MATH 1023

reviews.author: Todd
reviews.title: Worst professor ever seen
reviews.comment_content:
Thermodynamics, energy transfer, mass and energy, entropy

First two chapter are taught in secondary school
reviews.comment_teaching:
Worse professor ever seen. Bad pronunciation and he just refer to  the PowerPoint but nothing else. The pace of teaching is too fast, each example just give use about 30 seconds to 2 minutes to do. And end all the chapters two weeks before the study break.

飛書教，又唔比時間人

遇之則避之，避之則安之
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework (15%)
Mid-term (35%)
Final (50%)

Mine:
Homework (99/100)
Mid-term (80/100)
Final (Didn’t announce)

Final B+
reviews.comment_workload:
One homework per chapter, 7-8 questions per each.

Hard to do but still ok, need to take a bit of time to think about it.

reviews.author: plsquitust
reviews.title: 内容幾深
reviews.comment_content:
算係十分basic嘅mech course
内容上有d難理解，好多都完全未接觸過，最好花多d時間研究下

某程度上算係mech intro，因爲教嘅mass balance， control volume之類之後好多mech course都係base on 呢d 教
reviews.comment_teaching: 好有heart的prof，睇得出備好多課先教，内容都清晰，present得幾好，幾推薦
reviews.comment_grading:
正常grade
above mean少少就有b+
不過功課係十分之難，好多時完全無頭緒，相反考試會簡單好多，所以考試mean都幾高。
考試不難但要細心
reviews.comment_workload: hw 之外無野做，不過内容上要花好多時間

reviews.author: Fishball
reviews.title: 你會覺得好易 但係人地會覺得更加易
reviews.comment_content:
最Basic既Thermodynamics,
包括work done, entropy,efficiency,
又係一D操完數就會識做既野,
但係你覺得好易既同時,
你會有一班人兜得仲易
reviews.comment_teaching:
無咩聽上過堂,
所以真係無咩Comment,
不過佢間中有D Quiz仔,
上堂一開始講,
落堂果陣交,
所以如果唔想上堂就記得搵有上堂既FD提你
reviews.comment_grading:
個mean高到無眼睇,
以為自己好高分點知係Mean高小小,
之後Final炒左,
咁就C左,
個Grade唔算太好其實
reviews.comment_workload:
間中會有一份功課,
但係如果真係唔想做可以搵下網上面既Solution,
因為佢D Assignment全部係書後面既Exercise,
所以就睇你自己有無時間做啦,

reviews.author: An225 Mriya
reviews.title: New Professor
reviews.comment_content:
A total of 7 chapters:
1. Introduction and Basic Concepts
2. Energy, Energy Transfer and Basic Energy Analysis
3. Properties of Pure Substances
4. Energy Analysis for Closed Systems
5. Mass and Energy Analysis of Control Volumes
6. Second Law of Thermodynamics
7. Entropy

Previous experience in PHYS1112 (which covers the First and Second Law on Thermodynamics except entropy) helps with understanding this course's content. While one may be confused by the concepts of the course initially, practice make perfect, especially due to the fact that the course's question is rather the same. I recommend you buy the course's textbook or get some questions from your friend or the library.

That said, everything will be mixed up towards the end of the course (In Professor Fu's word, he could "design one question about entropy which covers everything from the beginning to the end"). If you can't catch up, you screw up. As commented by others, concepts about control volume in this course will be useful in MECH2210, so confusion in this course will lead to confusion later.

P.S. As a number of questions require reading steam tables and other tables, you are recommended to bring 2 rulers with you to locate the intended range on tables and avoid confusing numbers of other rows and columns.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Fu is new to HKUST. Perhaps due to a relative lack in teaching experience, I'll say that Professor Fu's teaching is too cramped. Examples on Chapter 3 and 4 (which is one of the foundations for later chapters) were flew through quickly. We only have some 5 minutes to think on each question before Professor Fu explained and revealed the answer.

Consequential to his fast pace, we were left with 1 free week (compared to extra lectures needed in the other lecture session) to revise everything before the final exam, though I think a more balanced teaching timetable is better for us.

Another minor criticism is that he assumed that most of the students know tabular interpolation, which caused confusion when we get data that don't correspond to steam table until it is explained in tutorials. While tabular interpolation itself only involve DSE Math skills, I believe it would be noteworthy to have a bit of explanation on these specified skills, especially the answers in teaching PowerPoint and textbook don't explain much on tabular interpolation.

While I generally don't link accent with teaching quality, his English speaking can be confusing due to heavy Chinese accent: pronouncing "work" as "wok" or "enthalpy" as "en-SAL-py" are some of the most common mispronunciations in his class. That said, I eventually adapted to his accent once I confirmed the actual meanings of his mispronounced words.
[N.B.: And... it seems that th-s-sh pronunciation confusion is quite common among Chinglish speakers?]

Speaking of our TAs, their tutorials mostly cover extra questions (usually 1 to 2 per tutorial), similar to MATH tutorials. As a result, I can only comment their teaching quality as "mediocre".
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework: 15% (Scores ranging from 83% to full mark, mostly at 9X%)
Midterm: 35% (90.1/100, mean 73.61/100)
Final: 50% (Never released)

Most assignment questions were on par with the that of examples in lectures. Some questions are designed to require cheats like WolframAlpha (or trial and error) to solve, so don't be shocked if you ended up with a mess that can't be solved by your calculator - after all they allow 5% error in answers.

In terms of the the midterm and final exams, both of their questions are noticeably easier than the homework questions. Our final exam even have a question that required us to prove the relation between the Kelvin-Planck statement and Clausius Statement of the Second Law of Thermodynamics, which would be easy for those who understand the course content well.

Ultimately get an A+ for the course. Judging from other's information, it seems that the course's grade is quite good: one of my friend also get A+, while another who reported himself screwing the final gets a B-range grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
A total of 7 assignments were released, each corresponded to one chapter. Among them, only 6 of them count towards the final homework grade.

On average, I spent 3 to 4 days for dealing with each assignments. Referring to extra problems in the textbook was sometimes needed. Of course, if you have a better understanding, you should spend less time to deal with assignments. Apart from that, most of the workload for me was related to extra questions in textbooks and revision for the midterm and final.

reviews.author: In FAA we trust
reviews.title: If you got professor Zhou as your instructor, swap section now.
reviews.comment_content:
1. Intro and Basic concept
2. General energy analysis
3. Properties of pure substances
4. Energy analysis in closed system
5. Mass and energy analysis of conteol volume
6. Second law of thermodynamics
7. Entropy
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Zhou's accent is difficult to understand, so do his teaching. He is always behind schedule and we ended up have to rush through the last chapter. Afterall, he is not a good instructor and teaches you virtually nothing.
If you got professor Zhou as your instructor, I strongly suggest you to immediately swap section.
The tutorial section is somewhat useful. The teaching of the TA is a lot better than that of the instructor. It teaches you how to do actual questions and it certainly saved the day.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework (15%)
Mid-term (35%)
Final (50%)
Each sections are separately graded.
The grading is somewhat lenient, even if you got the wrong answer, as long as your concept is correct and written down the equations, you will get majority of the marks.
The mid term is relatively easy. It mainly focusses on reading the table. However, the final exam is very difficult. It mainly focuses on entropy and requires a lot of calculations.
reviews.comment_workload: One homework per chapter. Each homework is very long and it takes me 2+ hours to complete it.

reviews.author: Great Dragon
reviews.comment_content:
1. Intro and Basic concept
2. General energy analysis
3. Properties of pure substances
4. Energy analysis in closed system
5. Mass and energy analysis of conteol volume
6. Second law of thermodynamics
7. Entropy
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Fu is nice and says he will maintain a good relationship with students. One time when I met him on campus, he recognized me and said hello to me. Some may said that the teaching pace is too fast, but I think it is still fine if you do enough revisions before the mid term and final exam.
reviews.comment_grading: Since he is a new prof, the grading is not bad.
reviews.comment_workload: One homework per chapter, the last homework is not graded and is used for revision.

reviews.author: SamuelLee
reviews.comment_content:
1 - Fundamentals
2- Basic energy analysis
3- properties of pure substances (focus in midterm)
4 - energy analysis of closed systems (focus in midterm)
5- mass and energy analysis of control volumes
6 - 2nd law of thermodynamics
7 - entropy (focus in final)
reviews.comment_teaching:
I have attended both Zhou Simen Y. and Fu Lin's classes.
The former has a very strong mainland accent and was hard to understand sometimes. The latter still has it but at least it is understandable. Both professors share the same set of ppt slides so it is easy to use it as reference.

The TA covers 2-3 examples per tutorial, and he gives us time to digest each example.
reviews.comment_grading:
15% Homework (scores ranging from 92% to full mark)
35% Midterm (98/100, mean slightly below 80)
50% Final (not released, but probably around 7x%, was quite hard)

Overall mean is 60-70.
I got an A-
reviews.comment_workload:
7 assignments in total, around 1 every 2 weeks. But one of the assignments is released around the study break. This isn't good so I am giving a C for this.

If you want to aim high, download the recommended textbook as the questions in the exams and homework come from there.

reviews.author: dnlmch
reviews.title: easy for everyone but not easy to get a good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Basic knowledge of thermal
Mid term exam requires students's ability of changing units.
Study more tutorial notes before exam is ok because it is similar with the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: quite boring for the lessons. Many students including me can't stop playing our phone during lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
Due to the unusual situation, no final exam in this semester.
25% hw  65% mid-term and 10% for essay.
I got 98.5/100 in mid-term so I got A finally.

But definitely the mean of mid term is high because it is easy. SO have to be careful if want to get a high grade in this course
reviews.comment_workload: Only few homeworks to do and studying mid term. And studying final exam.

reviews.author: benchan1113
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1:Introduction - Some basic concepts
Week 2:Introduction - Energy Analysis
Week 3:Introduction - Energy Analysis
Week 4:Properties of Pure Substance
Week 5:Properties of Pure Substance
Week 6:Work and heat
Week 7:First law of thermodynamics

Week 9:Second law of thermodynamics

reviews.comment_teaching: boring
reviews.comment_grading:
normal grading method
10% homework
35% midterm
55% final

special grading method in this semester
30% homework(6 homework in total)
60% midterm
10% project

I got
6 homework 100/100
midterm 88.5/100 (mean 86.6)
project 85/100

finally B+
reviews.comment_workload: Although there is only 6 homework, the question is hard.  It took me a few days to finish 1 homework.

reviews.comment_content: There are many examples in the PowerPoint.
reviews.comment_teaching: He will read the examples one by one and so boring. Some foreign students asked him questions and he just repeated what he said and don't have further explanation. Hope u can choose another professor.
reviews.comment_grading:
In the normal plan
Hw: 15%
midterm: 35%
Final: 50%
Due to social unrest, this plan was changed in this semester.
In this semester, we don't have final exam. A project was created instead.
The grading change to:
Homework: 30.0%
Mid-Term Exam: 60.0%
Final Project: 10.0%
reviews.comment_workload: One assignment per one character. If you 'don't know how to do'. Your 'best friend' can help you solve the problems.

reviews.author: Michael Cheung
reviews.title: Ordinary thermodynamics course
reviews.comment_content: For those who go for mech major, you have to take this course and the content is quite similar to mech 1906 in some way like the first and second law of thermodynamics. This one is a bit further but just add a little bit more equations only. Those are not really difficult if you practice more because this course is not really about understanding. It's just finding the required information from the property table and then you will get the answer correctly. But the content is not quite interesting, just a bunch of equations, curves and tables.
reviews.comment_teaching: My section instructor is a Chinese professor with a very strong Putonghua accent. Boring, just read aloud the powerpoint. Even though some foreign students asked him questions, he just repeated what he said without further explanation. Another foreign professor seems quite good and friendly (I just saw him during the mid-term) Comparing with the one in my section, he is quite handsome too! Hope you guys can have class with him!
reviews.comment_grading:
Actually I have been waiting for the release of mid-term result for a month already but it's still blank in the grade category. But overall, the mid-term exam is not difficult. As stated from the content that this course is a bunches of equations and curves, you don't have to memorize them because they are provided in the mid-term. And unlike other subject like phys1112 which provide all the equations in it's mid-term, this one only provides the NECESSARY equations so you don't need to choose which equation you have to use for answering. Of course, they are not in sequence with the questions but if you study carefully, you can distinguish them easily.
Hw: 15%
midterm: 35%
Final: 50%
However, this year social unrest is quite serious in HK so the professor cancels the final and the weighing will be different.
reviews.comment_workload: Until now I only have 5 hw only but there will a project which is a compensation for the cancellation of the final. The workload is not big. Each hw contains about 6-7 questions only. And of course, if you don't know how to do or if you want to "check the answer", slader is your best friend!

reviews.author: CKL
reviews.comment_content:
1. Introduction
2. Energy, energy transfer, and general energy analysis
3. Properties of pure substances
4. Energy analysis of closed systems
5. Mass and energy analysis of control volumes
6. The second law of thermodynamics
7. Entropy

Content is quite important, prerequisite for MECH 3300.

Many of the content is same as PHYS1112.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching of the professor is not quite good. The tone is quite boring. Since she carries some accent, it is quite difficult to listen.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework: 15%
Midterm: 35%
Final exam: 50%

Midterm mean: 73.2/100
Final exam score is not released.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is light, only have to finish 1 assignment each week.

reviews.author: Ray Siu
reviews.comment_content:
Content are not difficult, but only annoying to me
Energy analysis, Pure subtance, mass and energy analysis of control volumes, Work and heat, Second law of thermodynamics, Entropy and Irreversibility
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecturer has quite an accent, i haven't been to lecture after first few section
reviews.comment_grading: not paying too much attention to the course, self study only , do all the assignments with about 70% score rate, within one sd in both midterm and final exam, the final grade is B
reviews.comment_workload: assignment every week, if you have spent enough time on notes and lecture, should not be a problem

reviews.author: vick
reviews.comment_content:
Textbook- Thermodynamics an Engineering Approach

Energy analysis, Pure subtance, mass and energy analysis of control volumes, Work and heat, Second law of thermodynamics, Entropy and Irreversibility

Need to be familiar with using the tables to get values.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures usually include many worked examples from the textbook.
No attendance requirements. No in class quiz.
reviews.comment_grading:
Home work (15%)-  6 hw assignments in total
Mid term (35%)
Final (50%)

Mid term mean was around 70 and sd was 20. Final marks not released. No quiz.

Mean gets B+ grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Manageable workload. No quiz. The home work assignments towards the end of the semester can get quite long and challenging. Homework assignments are usually questions from the textbook.

reviews.author: yktchan
reviews.comment_content: 基本thermodynamics
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Huang 啲accent真心唔多掂，但係專心啲聽佢講野就會發現其實佢講得好清晰，要帶出嘅mainpoint都表達到
reviews.comment_grading: midterm below mean, assignment 差唔多滿分, final 無出分，拉翻有A range
reviews.comment_workload:
七個chapter有六份assignment，每份都至少四五題，如果之前無溫熟啲concept做熟啲problem set真係要花好多時間做hw
不過其實hw基本上係抄書有曬solution，唔想自己做都可以抄solution交功課

reviews.author: CharlieK
reviews.comment_content: pure substance; work and heat; control volume; Ideal and real gases. First and second laws of thermodynamics. Entropy. Elementary power and refrigeration cycles.
reviews.comment_teaching: Mainly read from powerpoint, give ample time for example discussion. But so far a bit boring since no other materials other than those on ppt will be covered, she speaks with strong chinese accent and often mispronounce words like 'Enthalpy" and 'Entropy'
reviews.comment_grading: Quite good in deed. Final 80/100, slightly above mean, final mark not disclosed, A-
reviews.comment_workload: Assignments every two weeks, sources can be easily found. Some quizzes, but they're generally easy

reviews.author: ggfook
reviews.title: core subject for mech
reviews.comment_content: The content mainly focuses on 1st, 2nd law of thermodynamics, entropy and  formulae related to them. All the formuale related to the exams were given in he exams. The content was pretty interesting and basic to support harder mechanical courses followed up.
reviews.comment_teaching: In general, if you try to focus, his teaching is not bad, but he usually looks on the ground, not students, so relatively less interactions between students and the professor.
reviews.comment_grading: If you can solve all ppt questions and some textbook questions, exams should be fine. All formulae were given for the exams and the final exam is shadow  grading. I got full mark form midterm and I couldnt finish solving one out of 6 questions from final and got A. The grading is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Usually there is no project given except studying for your own midterm and final. But there is a sudden pop up quiz to check your attendance and the quiz weighs quite high, so try not to miss your quiz. He is generous enough that he lets people to hand in the quiz after the lecture ends, so be alert for quiz from your friends at least!

reviews.author: etkf
reviews.comment_content:
The content has been mentioned by other reviewers, so I am going to only briefly describe it.
It is basically the fundamentals of thermodynamics, as the course title suggested, including hydrostatics, enthalpy, entropy, 1st & 2nd law of thermodynamics, basics of mass&heat transfer, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof's teaching skills are not terrible, but not good either. Maybe it is mainly because of the heavy mainland accent of English.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is very good. A range can be easily achieved, although A+ might not be easy since the entire course, including the exams, are very simple, thus many students getting high scores in exams and assignments.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is very light. There were only a few assignments, which are extracted from the textbook directly, meaning that you can get the solution manual somewhere else and copy, if you wish.
There were also some in-class quiz, but they are extremely easy, sometimes so easy that I thought it is a trick or something. I think they are only intended for attendance taking in a different way, i.e. the quiz.

reviews.author: ching
reviews.title: quite easy course
reviews.comment_content:
very basic thermodynamics in the content which most of the material have been learnt in the high school.
Quiz, test and finals are mainly calculation. As long as you understand the calculations in the examples of the lecture notes, its easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: no comment as my attendance...
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance is not sooo important.
You get a fine grade if you do well in the midterms and final.
reviews.comment_workload:
weekly assignment, which are all calculation.
Sometimes the question is a bit hard, but there will be no problem if you got the answer key hahaa.
understanding the answer helps a lot in your revision.

reviews.author: Catenary
reviews.title: Thermodynamics
reviews.comment_content: Fundamental concepts; pure substance; work and heat; control volume; Ideal and real gases. First and second laws of thermodynamics. Entropy. Elementary power and refrigeration cycles.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is always reading off the presentation and sometime you will have hard time understanding what they are saying if you are horrible at understanding English in Chinese accent
reviews.comment_grading: It is manageable able to have a good grade if you work hard enough. Some sections are harder than others and you must know all the concepts thoroughly to solve questions either it is an assignment or assessment
reviews.comment_workload: It’s that class that requires a lot of effort.

reviews.comment_content:
1. Introduction
2. Energy, energy transfer, and general energy analysis
3. Properties of pure substances
4. Energy analysis of closed systems
5. Mass and energy analysis of control volumes
6. The second law of thermodynamics
7. Entropy
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor can be quite boring and she mostly reads off of the powerpoint. Also, her pronunciation has an extremely strong local accent so it is difficult to understand and focus on the content.
There is no attendance requirement.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is not good in my opinion.
Although midterm is quite easy, the final exam incorporates many concepts into one question so if you are not confident with all concepts, it is likely that you will struggle throughout the exam.
reviews.comment_workload: There are weekly assignments. In the beginning it is quite light but towards the end, there tends to be many more questions so it will take quite a long time to finish the assignment.

energy, entropy,efficiency
每教1個chapter 都有一個assignment + 1個堂上quiz (聲稱會計分)
唔take attendance

超悶,不過算教得唔錯, note 寫得幾好,
tutor 都教得幾好, 得閒都值得上, 佢會教你點諗數, 點做數
有take attendance through quiz ,quiz唔難, 大慨完一個chapter 一個quiz

The final chapter will be entropy will is the main focus of this course.

reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite satisfactort. I got  1 sd above the mean in mid-term. However, The mark of final will not be released but i guess not doing very well, maybe be as mean. Turn out i got B+.
